datafield.subfield: Title from inscription on upper board lining:
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 571
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper, etc. may suggest late early 16th century.
Accompanying materials: a. Inventory cataloguing slip in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas (pp.1-2) -- b. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda (pp.3-4).
Former shelfmark: From interior of upper cover and spine label "IL 69" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in marbled paper (in salmon, blue, yellow, etc.) with red leather over spine, fore edge flap, and edges/turn-ins ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in untinted laid European paper (watermark partially visible) ; sewn in dull pink thread, two stations, broken in many quires ; endbands virtually gone with trace of core at head ; overall in poor condition with flap fully detached, severe abrasion and staining (much of original marbling now lost), lifting and losses of leather, quires detaching from spine, etc.

Support: non-European (likely Arab) laid paper with 8 laid lines per cm. (20 in 25 mm., vertical), chain lines (horizontal) grouped in threes with 12-14 mm. between chains and 43-45 mm. between groups ; fairly sturdy and dense, well-burnished to glossy.
Decoration: Keywords and abbreviation symbols (mainly two teeth stroke) rubricated ; accents in red highlight other keywords ; textual dividers in the form of red inverted commas.

Script: Nastaʻlīq (talik) ; compact, elegant Turkish hand ; virtually serifless with marked tilt to the right, only slight effect of words descending to baseline, exaggerated elongation of horizontal strokes, pointing in strokes rather than distinct dots, free assimilation of letters (e.g. point of final nūn assimilated with bowl, etc.).
Layout: Written in 21 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: i, 15 V(150) ; exclusively quinions ; catchwords present ; foliation in black ink, Hindu-Arabic numerals ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes inserts and flyleaves).
Explicit: "فشهدت القابلة عن انفصاله حيا اجمعوا على انه يقبل شهادتها في حق الصلوة عليه وهل يقبل شهادتها في حق الارث قال ابو ح [اي ابو حنيفة] رحه [اي رحمه الله] لا تقبل وقالا تقبل"

Incipit: "يقول العبد الضعيف محمد بن محمود بن الحسن الاستروشني ... الحمد لله الذي بهرت حجته وظهرت على الخلائق محجته ... وبعد فان الناس في اهوائهم [مختلفون وفي طبائعهم وآرائهم] متباينون وعلى مقادير هممهم يكدحون ...ولما قعدت همتهم لحالتهم مع حسن آلتهم اردت ان احرز جملة من المسائل ... فانتقيت [منها] احكام الصغائر والصغار واودعتها في هذا الاوراق القصار ... وسميت هذا المجموع جامع الصغار وارجو ان يكون وسيلة لي لدفع الهوان والصغار ..."
Title from opening matter on p.9.
Clear copy of a collection of legal decisions pertaining to children, lacking the final three masāʼil and khātimah. Contents listing at opening (pp.5-6).
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Owners marks on 'title page' (p.7) include an effaced statement, an ownership statement in name of one Şeyhzade Abdullah reads "من متملكات الفقير عبد الله الشهير بشيخ زاده", and an ownership statement in name of one Muhittinzade reads "ثم انتقل الى الفقير اليه سبحانه وتعالى محى الدين زاده" ; kabīkaj invocation on 'title page' (p.7) "يا كبيكج" ; glosses (some arranged artistically) and marginal corrections.
